intro: Dupatya blanchetiana, commonly known as the Philippine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the rainy season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
